resources.string: Select what you\'re looking for from the list below (multiple selections are allowed)...
Pub on the north side of the city
Pub on the south side of the city
What pub are you looking for?

string.name: disclaimer
string.i: Disclaimer: Live music, live sports and late opening only on certain nights. Ratings and descriptions based on Google Reviews

resources.string: Invalid selection. Please select either a Traditional Irish pub OR a Modern pub
Invalid selection. Please select either a Pub on the north side of the city OR a Pub on the south side of the city
No pubs match your search. Please try again
Error retrieving pub type and side of city
Modern bar with a huge array of local and international craft beers on tap and big-screen TV sport
Glitter balls and chandeliers give a young edge to a simple menu of international dishes
Full of vintage ephemera, this large, lively bar, restaurant and nightclub includes a roof terrace
Bustling joint with an Irish heavy rock heritage, with 3 bars and live music, plus TV sports
Vibrant modern bar with nightly live bands, TV sports, cocktail classes, stag and hen parties
Elegant art nouveau bar spread over 3 floors with doric columns and glass panelled ceilings
This classic pub houses 2 fine old snugs (small rooms for women in days of old) and an Irish menu
This 19th century bar with bare brick walls and stripped wood floors serves pub grub classics
Classic pub with a predilection for hard guitar music with brick walls, pool tables and beer garden
A quaint pub facade gives way to a cavernous and wood-filled interior at this late opening pub/bar
Brick walled bar with high beamed ceilings creating large music venue with memorabilia-covered bar
Higgledy piggledy artworks by local artists dot the walls of this local pub which hosts book events
Spacious bar with upstairs room for typical selection of beer in Victorian surroundings
Long established, traditional pub with a dark wooden bar, picture framed snug and popular beer yard
Typical Irish ground floor pub with 1st floor venue for the leading lights in live jazz and blues
Classic pub scattered with original features such as mahogany doors and wood partitioned snug areas
No nonsense 18th century pub with a cast of regulars and lack of modern pomposity
Adjacent to the back door of the Gaiety Theatre, this is a favourite of stage folk and theatergoers
Large and lively Victorian era bar with iron chandeliers and church pews hosting Saturday rock club
Traditional, convivial and compact pub with white walls, serving whiskies, beers and sandwiches
Funky murals and vintage accents adorn this chic, spacious bar for cocktails and sharing platters

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk around Trinity College. Take the first right turn and walk all the way up Dawson Street. Then, turn left at St. Stephen\'s Green and continue on to Merrion Row. Walk up this street and continue onto Baggot Street Lower. At the end of this street, walk over the bridge and continue onto Baggot Street Upper. You will see Searson\'s at the end of this street on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the fourth right turn onto Chatham Street. Walk a few feet up this street and you will see Sheehan\'s on the right hand corner.

From O\' Connell Street, walk towards O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Bachelors Walk. Walk straight up this street and continue on past the Ha\'penny bridge onto Ormond Quay Lower. Continue straight, past the Millenium bridge, then past Grattan bridge onto Ormond Quay Upper. You will see Sin É a few feet up on the right.
From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the last right turn onto South King Street. You will see Synnott\'s on the left.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and continue straight onto Westmoreland Street. Walk up this street and take the first right turn onto Fleet Street. Walk up this street and you will soon see The Auld Dubliner on the left hand corner.

From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and continue straight up Westmoreland Street. Walk to the end of this street and onto College Green (Trinity College). Turn to face Dame Street and you will see The Bank a few feet up on the left hand side.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up this street and take the second left turn onto Trinity Street. Walk a few feet up this street and you will see the Banker\'s on the right hand corner
Hip, bare bones hangout with art and sofas in a townhouse hotel, popular for brunch and mojitos
From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the first left turn onto Duke Street. You will see the Bailey Bar on the left.

From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight along the Quays, past the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight, past the Millenium bridge. You will soon see The Bison Bar on the left.

From O\' Connell Street (the Spire), turn to face O\' Connell bridge and walk straight. Take the second left turn onto Abbey Street Lower. Walk all the way up this street and around the bus garage (Busáras). You will see The Brew Dock straight in front of you.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up the entire length of this street, past City Hall, and continue straight onto Lord Edward Street. You will see The Bull And Castle at the end of this street on the left corner.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk straight up Dame Street and take the third left turn onto South Great George\'s Street. Walk straight up this street and continue onto Aungier Street. Walk straight up this street and continue onto Wexford Street. Continue straight onto Camden Street and you will see The Camden Exchange on the right.

From College Green (Trinity College), walk straight up Dame Street. Take the third left turn onto South Great George\'s Street. Walk up this street until you come to Aungier Street. You will see the Capitol Bar on the left corner.

From O\' Connell Street (the Spire), turn to face O\' Connell bridge and turn left onto Earl Street North. Walk up this street and continue on to Talbot Street. Walk down Talbot Street and you will soon see The Celt on the right.
From O\' Connell Street (the Spire), turn to face O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Henry Street. Walk all the way up this street and you will see The Church on the left hand corner.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight until you come to the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight until you come to the Millennium bridge. Then, turn left onto Eustace Street and turn right onto Essex Street. Walk up this street and you will see The Czech Inn on the right hand corner.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up this street and take the second left turn onto Trinity Street. Then, take the first right turn onto Dame Lane. Walk up this lane and you will see Dame Tavern on the left hand corner.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk around Trinity College. Take the first right turn onto Dawson Street. Walk all the way up this street and you will see The Dawson Lounge on the right.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up this street and take the third left turn and walk up South Great George\'s Street. Take the third left turn onto Fade Street. Walk to the end of this street and you will see The Drury Buildings across the road.
From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the first left turn onto Duke Street. You will see The Duke on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk down Nassau Street. Take the first right turn and walk all the way up Dawson Street. Then, turn left and walk around St. Stephen\'s Green. Turn left onto Leeson Street Lower and you will immediately see the East Side Tavern.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Then, turn left and walk straight towards Grafton Street. Walk a few feet up Grafton Street and take the first right turn onto Wicklow Street. Walk up this street continue onto Exchequer Street. You will see The Exchequer at the end of this street on the right hand corner.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight until you come to the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight until you come to the Millennium bridge. Then, turn left onto Eustace Street and turn right onto Essex Street East. You will see the Garage Bar a few feet up on the right.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up this street and take the third left turn onto South Great George\'s Street. Walk a few feet up this street and you will see The George on the right.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk around Trinity College. Continue straight onto Nassau Street, then onto Leinster Street South. At the end of this street, turn left onto Lincoln Place. Walk up this street and continue onto Fenian Street. You will see The Gingerman on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up this street and take the third left turn onto South Great George\'s Street. Walk a few feet up this street and you will see The Globe Bar on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the first left turn onto Duke Street. Then, take the first right turn onto Duke Lane Upper. You will see The Grafton Lounge a few feet down on the left.

From O\'Connell Street (the Spire), turn to face O\' Connell bridge and walk straight. Take the first right turn onto Abbey Street Lower. Walk up this street and take the first left turn onto Liffey Street Lower. Walk up this street and you will see The Grand Social on the right.
From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk up this street towards the Ha\'penny bridge. You will soon see The Gypsy Rose on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the first right turn onto Wicklow Street and then take the second left turn onto William Street South. Walk all the way up this street and take the last right turn. You will see The Hairy Lemon on the right hand corner.

From O\'Connell Street (the Spire), turn to face O\' Connell bridge and walk straight. Take the second left turn onto Abbey Street Lower. Walk all the way up this street and around the bus garage (Busáras). Turn right and walk into the IFSC. You will see the Harbourmaster on the left corner.

From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight along the Quays, past the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight, past the Millenium bridge. You will soon see The Liquor Room\'s on the left.
From O\'Connell Street (the Spire), turn away from O\' Connell bridge and walk straight. Take the second right turn onto Cathal Brugha Street and you will see The Living Room on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn right and walk up College Street. Continue onto Pearse Street. Walk all the way up this street and you will see The Lombard on the left hand corner.
From College Green (Trinity College), walk straight up Dame Street. Take the third left turn and walk up South Great George\'s Street. The Long Hall is just beyond Fade Street.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and continue straight onto D\' Olier Street. Walk up this street and turn left onto Townsend Street. Walk up this street and you will soon see The Long Stone on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up this street and take the third left turn and walk up South Great George\'s Street. Take the third left turn onto Fade Street. You will see The Market Bar a few feet away.
From College Green (Trinity College), walk straight up Dame Street. Continue on past Church Lane and Trinity Street. You will soon see the Mercantile on the left.

From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and continue straight onto Westmoreland Street. Take the first right turn onto Fleet Street. Walk a few feet up this street and you will see The Morgan Bar on the right.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight until you come to the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight until you come to the Millennium bridge. Then, turn left onto Eustace Street. Walk up this street and you will see The Norseman on the left hand corner.

From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight along the Quays, past the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight, past the Millenium bridge. You will soon see The Octagon Bar on the left.
Old Railway Station, 57 Harcourt Street, Dublin 2

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk all the way up Grafton Street. Then, turn right and walk past St. Stephen\'s Green. Continue straight onto Harcourt Street. Walk all the way up this street and you will see The Odeon on the left.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Then, turn left and walk straight towards Grafton Street. Walk a few feet up Grafton Street and take the first right turn onto Wicklow Street. Walk up this street and you will see The Old Stand across the road on the right hand corner.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and continue straight onto Westmoreland Street. Walk up this street and take the first right turn onto Fleet Street. Walk up this street and you will soon see Oliver St. John Gogarty\'s on the left hand corner.
From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and continue straight onto Westmoreland Street. Take the first right turn onto Fleet Street. You will see The Palace Bar on the right.
From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Nassau Street. You will see Porterhouse Central a few feet up on the right.
From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and turn left onto Burgh Quay. You will see the River Bar on the right.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Turn left and walk up Grafton Street. Take the first right turn onto Wicklow Street and then take the second left turn onto William Street South. Walk up this street and you will soon see the South William on the left.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and continue straight onto D\'Olier Street. At the end of this street, take a right up to College Green. From there, walk up Dame Street and turn left onto Trinity Street. Turn right onto Dame Lane and you\'ll see The Stag\'s Head up on the left.
From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk up Dame Street. Continue on past Church Lane. Continue on past Trinity Street. You will soon see The Sweeney Mongrel on the left.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight until you come to the Ha\'penny bridge. Then, turn left and walk under Merchant Arch. You are now in Temple Bar, the Temple Bar is down the cobblestones on the right.

From O\'Connell Street, walk over O\'Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight until you come to the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight until you come to the Millennium bridge. Then, turn left onto Eustace Street and turn right onto Essex Street East. Walk up this street and you will see The Turk\'s Head on the left hand corner.

From College Green (Trinity College), turn to face Dame Street. Walk straight up Dame Street and take the third left turn onto South Great George\'s Street. Walk straight up this street and continue onto Aungier Street. Walk straight up this street and continue onto Wexford Street. You will see Whelan\'s a few feet up on the right.
The Parnell Centre, Parnell Street, Dublin 1

From O\'Connell Street (the Spire), turn away from O\' Connell bridge and walk straight. At the end of the Street, turn left onto Parnell Street. Walk all the way up this street and you will see The Woolshed on the right

From O\' Connell Street, walk over O\' Connell bridge and turn right onto Aston Quay. Walk straight along the Quays, past the Ha\'penny bridge. Continue on straight, past the Millenium bridge. You will soon see The Workman\'s Club on the left.
